alert.note: Alert for Cheatham (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 12:17AM CST until further notice by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Sycamore Creek Near Ashland City affecting Cheatham County. For the Sycamore Creek...including Ashland City...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Sycamore Creek Near Ashland City. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Low lying and agricultural areas along Sycamore Creek are inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 10.1 feet and rising. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 615 PM CST.
